channel.title: My Current Project
channel.description:
Oh well. no pictures. too bad. here's the source. have fun.
http://uppit.com/MIFCNL
Sorry about the "poor" conventions. it's just the way i was taught. it's either that, or ave not tabs, and no indents at all.

item.title: My Current Project
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:14, topic:216858”][quote author=pizza pie link=topic=285060.msg2310679#msg2310679 date=1215039271]
Alright, well that one is not as bad, here are some tips:

  • Only about a fifth of the stuff on there work
  • Still a wee bit ugly
  • Don’t want to look at the source code because its prolly the same throughout
  • Also, the TextField for the password should be a PasswordField
  • Lastly, don’t release stuff if you’re not done.
    [/quote]

The same could be said to your father. It’s called premature ejaculation.[/quote][quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:14, topic:216858”][quote author=pizza pie link=topic=285060.msg2310679#msg2310679 date=1215039271]
Alright, well that one is not as bad, here are some tips:

  • Only about a fifth of the stuff on there work
  • Still a wee bit ugly
  • Don’t want to look at the source code because its prolly the same throughout
  • Also, the TextField for the password should be a PasswordField
  • Lastly, don’t release stuff if you’re not done.
    [/quote]

The same could be said to your father. It’s called premature ejaculation.[/quote]Is that why your mom was so mad when you were born?

item.title: My Current Project
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

public class Test
	{
		public static void Encrypt()
			{
				InputStreamReader Input = new InputStreamReader(System.in);
				BufferedReader Console = new BufferedReader(Input);
				
				try
					{
						System.out.println("Where is the file you want to encrypt? ");
						File Directory = new File(Console.readLine());

Terrible conventions. Read up on this: http://java.sun.com/docs/codeconv/

You are providing a tool for users to hardcode certain objects? Don’t do that, ever.

I stopped looking after that. Your indenting/naming/etc hurts my eyes.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

zyle1992:

no, i have to post a shit load of pictures because my mac has no video, slideshow capabilities. i can’t make a slideshow on photobucket, because my flash isnt high enough. and i can’t upgrade my flash because my GPU is out of date.

You can however post a few pictures, perhaps one or two. Not 10. Or, you can thumbnail them.
